THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENT.SECRET,W.P. (G) (4Q).WAR CABINET.PALESTINE LAND MEASURES.Note by the First Lord of the Admiralty.I circulate to my colleagues a copy of a telegramaddressed to me "by Doctor Weizmann.(intd. ) V/. S. C.February 24th 1940.Copy No.
TELEGRAM.Winston Churchill, Admiralty, London.Am informed introduction land measures likelyalmost immediately stop Sentiment here in general friendlyAllies "but highly sensitive stop Am deeply convinced this measure -would have most deplorable reactions not alone in Jev;ishcircles stop Have done level best explain Britain to peoplehere Am leaving by Clipper plane March sixth and most earnestlyrequest Prime Minister hold up introduction these measures tillhave had opportunity seeing him stop Sorry trouble you butgravity situation impels me ask your intervention once more.weizraann.
